result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kasonja Latavia Noblin

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kasonja Latavia Noblin in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Kasonja Latavia Noblin.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Final pretrial conference held.  Parties remain in trial posture. Jury trial remains scheduled on 11/07/22 in Branch 1.
from the state, filed.  rmm, filed.  rmm

Defendant Kasonja Latavia Noblin in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for pre-trial. Pretrial conference held. Defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned to Br. 1.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (6-9-2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with  S.D. and S.H.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kasonja Latavia Noblin in court.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 01.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 01 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/07/2022@1p
